conversations_v0.question: Can you explain why angle CPA is half of the measure of arc BCD in the given image?
conversations_v0.answer: In a circle, the measure of an inscribed angle is always half the measure of the arc it subtends. Since angle CPA is an inscribed angle subtending arc BCD, its measure is half of arc BCD. This principle follows from the properties of circles where the angle formed inside the circle by chords is always half the arc covered by these chords opposite the angle.
